qa module

qa.load(archive_dir: str, archive_name: str, mode: str, force=False)[source]

It creates a file called metafile.qa in the directory that is being archived. It then writes the absolute path of the directory to the file. It then makes the archive and removes the metafile.

Parameters

  • archive_dir (str) – The directory that is being archived

  • archive_name (str) – The name of the archive

  • mode (str) – This is the compression used. Can be ‘xz’, ‘gz’, or ‘bz2’.

qa.main()[source]

It checks if the first argument is load or unload, and if it is, it runs the load or unload function.

qa.unload(archive_name: str, force=False)[source]

It takes an archive file, decompresses it to a temporary directory, reads the metafile.qa file to get the path of the directory that was archived, and then copies the files from the temporary directory to the directory that was held within the metafile then deletes the metafile.

Parameters

archive_name (str) – The name of the archive file

qa.usage()[source]
